description:
Users can interact with the multitouch joystick to specify angle and amplitude values.  These values can be used to control other objects in the scene such as movement and rotation, such as for twin-stick shooter games.

Mulitouch buttons can be used whenever a game allows the user to press multiple locations at once.

How to use:

- Add the joystick behavior to a sprite that will be the joystick 
- Place the joystick object on the scene
- Run the "Activate joystick" action on every frame and specify the thumb object
- The joystick thumb object will automatically be created and moved

Tips:

- Use "Simulate a touch" functions to provide mouse and gamepad controls
- More than one joystick or button can be used at the same time
- Joystick and thumb objects should have all sides the same length
- Thumb object must be smaller than the joystick object
name: MultitouchJoystick
shortDescription: Activate a joystick or buttons that can be controlled by interacting with a touchscreen.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Activate a joystick that can be controlled by interacting with a touchscreen.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: MultitouchJoystick

eventsFunctions.name: ActivateJoystick
eventsFunctions.sentence: Activate joystick _PARAM0_ using _PARAM2_ as the thumbstick

events.comment: Create joystick thumb and link it to the joystick
Reset values (except for angle, which stays the same)
Calculate the percent of distance the thumb has moved from the center of joystick.
Start with thumb in the center (acts like a spring on a real controller)
Move joystick thumb to the location of the touch (but stay inside joystick)
If floating is enabled, move joystick to keep touch inside

eventsFunctions.description: Percent amount the thumb has been pulled away from the joystick center (Range: 0 to 1).
eventsFunctions.name: JoystickAmplitude

eventsFunctions.description: Angle the joystick is pointing towards (Range: -180 to 180).
eventsFunctions.name: JoystickAngle

eventsFunctions.description: Check if joystick amplitude is greater or equal to a value.
eventsFunctions.name: CheckJoystickAmplitude
eventsFunctions.sentence: Amplitude of _PARAM0_ is  greater or equal to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Check if joystick is pushed in a given direction.
eventsFunctions.name: DirectionPushed

eventsFunctions.description: Enable (or disable) floating on a joystick.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Enable (or disable) floating on a joystick
eventsFunctions.name: SetFloating

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a joystick is pressed.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressed

eventsFunctions.description: Simulate a touch on joystick (based on position).  Can be used for mouse controls.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Simulate a touch on joystick (based on position)
eventsFunctions.name: SimulateTouch_Position
eventsFunctions.sentence: Simulate a touch on joystick _PARAM0_ with thumb _PARAM2_ at position: _PARAM3_ px, _PARAM4_ px

events.comment: Calculate the percent of distance the thumb has moved from the center of joystick.
Move joystick thumb to the location of the touch (but stay inside joystick)
If floating is enabled, move joystick to keep touch inside

eventsFunctions.description: Simulate a touch on joystick (based on angle and amplitude).  Can be used for gamepad controls.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Simulate a touch on joystick (based on angle and amplitude)
eventsFunctions.name: SimulateTouch_AngleAmplitude
eventsFunctions.sentence: Simulate a touch on joystick _PARAM0_ with thumb _PARAM2_ to angle _PARAM3_ and amplitude _PARAM4_

events.comment: Move joystick thumb to the location of the touch (but stay inside joystick)

eventsFunctions.name: SimulateTouchEnded
eventsFunctions.sentence: Simulate a touch ended on joystick _PARAM0_ with thumb _PARAM2_

propertyDescriptors.label: Enable player to drag joystick around (floating)
propertyDescriptors.name: EnableFloating

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Detect button presses made from a touchscreen.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: MultitouchButton

events.comment: Check all new touches to see if one started on this object
